guide.title: Gentoo Weekly Newsletter
guide.subtitle: 5 February 2007
guide.abstract: This is the Gentoo Weekly Newsletter for the week of 5 February 2007.

body.p: Hanno Boeck recently added Metisse to his svn overlay. Metisse is the answer from Mandriva to compiz, and the whole 3d-desktop thing.

Metisse has some some features that gives the possibility to transform the natural shape of windows. A few examples of this are: rotating, scaling, zooming your windows. You can even make a parallellogram from your window! Mettisse runs on its own native X-Server, which is luminocity/xgl-alike and a modified variant of fvwm.

Unfortunately Metisse is still missing an amd64 version, but that is taken care of upstream. Also we're patiently waitint for a new version where the coders should fix some known bugs. For more information on where to get the sources, and how to start the environment, please read the original blog post which listed below.
